intro: Heydia horrida, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Heydia horrida is a herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its botanical features make it easily identifiable, though it is sometimes confused with other similar species in the Asteraceae family.
